words.etymology_text: From Ancient Greek Ξέρξης (Xérxēs), from Old Persian 𐎧𐏁𐎹𐎠𐎼𐏁𐎠 (x-š-y-a-r-š-a /⁠Xšayāršā⁠/, “ruler among kings”).

raw_glosses: (medicine) A xenotransplant (that which is transplanted in a xenotransplantation).
glosses: A xenotransplant (that which is transplanted in a xenotransplantation).

raw_glosses: (rare) A xenotransplantation (transplantation of tissue from one species to another).
glosses: A xenotransplantation (transplantation of tissue from one species to another).

forms.form: Rare. Only used with substantive adjectives.

words.etymology_text: Internationalism (see English xenobiotic). Adapted with the adjectival suffix + -inen.

raw_glosses: (medicine) xenotransplantation (transplantation of an organ or part thereof from one species to another)..
glosses: xenotransplantation (transplantation of an organ or part thereof from one species to another)..

words.etymology_text: Internationalism (see English xylophonist). Contains the suffix -isti.
Internationalism (see English xylographer). Contains the suffix -grafi.

forms.form: Rare. Only used with substantive adjectives.

words.etymology_text: Internationalism (see English xenophobic). Adapted with the adjectival suffix + -inen.

raw_glosses: (jargon) Synonym of puukaiverrus (“xylography”) (art of making xylographs)
glosses: Synonym of puukaiverrus (“xylography”) (art of making xylographs)

raw_glosses: (jargon) Synonym of puukaiverrus (“xylograph”) (engraving in wood, especially one used for printing)
glosses: Synonym of puukaiverrus (“xylograph”) (engraving in wood, especially one used for printing)

raw_glosses: (jargon) Synonym of puupiirros (“xylograph”) (print taken from an engraving in wood)
glosses: Synonym of puupiirros (“xylograph”) (print taken from an engraving in wood)

synonyms.extra: (“xylograph”) (print taken from an engraving in wood)

words.etymology_text: Internationalism (see French xylographie). Contains the suffix -grafia.
